00043 /* *****************************************************************************
00044                 SOFTWARE API FOR AIC
00045    ***************************************************************************** */
00046 #define AT91C_AIC_BRANCH_OPCODE ((void (*) ()) 0xE51FFF20) // ldr, pc, [pc, #-&F20]
00047 
00048 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00049 //* \fn    AT91F_AIC_ConfigureIt
00050 //* \brief Interrupt Handler Initialization
00051 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00052 __inline unsigned int AT91F_AIC_ConfigureIt (
00053         AT91PS_AIC pAic,  // \arg pointer to the AIC registers
00054         unsigned int irq_id,     // \arg interrupt number to initialize
00055         unsigned int priority,   // \arg priority to give to the interrupt
00056         unsigned int src_type,   // \arg activation and sense of activation
00057         void (*newHandler) () ) // \arg address of the interrupt handler
00058 {
00059         unsigned int oldHandler;
00060     unsigned int mask ;
00061 
00062     oldHandler = pAic->AIC_SVR[irq_id];
00063 
00064     mask = 0x1 << irq_id ;
00065     //* Disable the interrupt on the interrupt controller
00066     pAic->AIC_IDCR = mask ;
00067     //* Save the interrupt handler routine pointer and the interrupt priority
00068     pAic->AIC_SVR[irq_id] = (unsigned int) newHandler ;
00069     //* Store the Source Mode Register
00070     pAic->AIC_SMR[irq_id] = src_type | priority  ;
00071     //* Clear the interrupt on the interrupt controller
00072     pAic->AIC_ICCR = mask ;
00073 
00074         return oldHandler;
00075 }
00076 
00077 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00078 //* \fn    AT91F_AIC_EnableIt
00079 //* \brief Enable corresponding IT number
00080 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00081 __inline void AT91F_AIC_EnableIt (
00082         AT91PS_AIC pAic,      // \arg pointer to the AIC registers
00083         unsigned int irq_id ) // \arg interrupt number to initialize
00084 {
00085     //* Enable the interrupt on the interrupt controller
00086     pAic->AIC_IECR = 0x1 << irq_id ;
00087 }
00088 
00089 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00090 //* \fn    AT91F_AIC_DisableIt
00091 //* \brief Disable corresponding IT number
00092 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00093 __inline void AT91F_AIC_DisableIt (
00094         AT91PS_AIC pAic,      // \arg pointer to the AIC registers
00095         unsigned int irq_id ) // \arg interrupt number to initialize
00096 {
00097     unsigned int mask = 0x1 << irq_id;
00098     //* Disable the interrupt on the interrupt controller
00099     pAic->AIC_IDCR = mask ;
00100     //* Clear the interrupt on the Interrupt Controller ( if one is pending )
00101     pAic->AIC_ICCR = mask ;
00102 }
00103 
00104 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00105 //* \fn    AT91F_AIC_ClearIt
00106 //* \brief Clear corresponding IT number
00107 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00108 __inline void AT91F_AIC_ClearIt (
00109         AT91PS_AIC pAic,     // \arg pointer to the AIC registers
00110         unsigned int irq_id) // \arg interrupt number to initialize
00111 {
00112     //* Clear the interrupt on the Interrupt Controller ( if one is pending )
00113     pAic->AIC_ICCR = (0x1 << irq_id);
00114 }
00115 
00116 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00117 //* \fn    AT91F_AIC_AcknowledgeIt
00118 //* \brief Acknowledge corresponding IT number
00119 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00120 __inline void AT91F_AIC_AcknowledgeIt (
00121         AT91PS_AIC pAic)     // \arg pointer to the AIC registers
00122 {
00123     pAic->AIC_EOICR = pAic->AIC_EOICR;
00124 }
00125 
00126 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00127 //* \fn    AT91F_AIC_SetExceptionVector
00128 //* \brief Configure vector handler
00129 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00130 __inline unsigned int  AT91F_AIC_SetExceptionVector (
00131         unsigned int *pVector, // \arg pointer to the AIC registers
00132         void (*Handler) () )   // \arg Interrupt Handler
00133 {
00134         unsigned int oldVector = *pVector;
00135 
00136         if ((unsigned int) Handler == (unsigned int) AT91C_AIC_BRANCH_OPCODE)
00137                 *pVector = (unsigned int) AT91C_AIC_BRANCH_OPCODE;
00138         else
00139                 *pVector = (((((unsigned int) Handler) - ((unsigned int) pVector) - 0x8) >> 2) & 0x00FFFFFF) | 0xEA000000;
00140 
00141         return oldVector;
00142 }
00143 
00144 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00145 //* \fn    AT91F_AIC_Trig
00146 //* \brief Trig an IT
00147 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00148 __inline void  AT91F_AIC_Trig (
00149         AT91PS_AIC pAic,     // \arg pointer to the AIC registers
00150         unsigned int irq_id) // \arg interrupt number
00151 {
00152         pAic->AIC_ISCR = (0x1 << irq_id) ;
00153 }
00154 
00155 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00156 //* \fn    AT91F_AIC_IsActive
00157 //* \brief Test if an IT is active
00158 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00159 __inline unsigned int  AT91F_AIC_IsActive (
00160         AT91PS_AIC pAic,     // \arg pointer to the AIC registers
00161         unsigned int irq_id) // \arg Interrupt Number
00162 {
00163         return (pAic->AIC_ISR & (0x1 << irq_id));
00164 }
00165 
00166 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00167 //* \fn    AT91F_AIC_IsPending
00168 //* \brief Test if an IT is pending
00169 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00170 __inline unsigned int  AT91F_AIC_IsPending (
00171         AT91PS_AIC pAic,     // \arg pointer to the AIC registers
00172         unsigned int irq_id) // \arg Interrupt Number
00173 {
00174         return (pAic->AIC_IPR & (0x1 << irq_id));
00175 }
00176 
00177 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00178 //* \fn    AT91F_AIC_Open
00179 //* \brief Set exception vectors and AIC registers to default values
00180 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00181 __inline void AT91F_AIC_Open(
00182         AT91PS_AIC pAic,        // \arg pointer to the AIC registers
00183         void (*IrqHandler) (),  // \arg Default IRQ vector exception
00184         void (*FiqHandler) (),  // \arg Default FIQ vector exception
00185         void (*DefaultHandler)  (), // \arg Default Handler set in ISR
00186         void (*SpuriousHandler) (), // \arg Default Spurious Handler
00187         unsigned int protectMode)   // \arg Debug Control Register
00188 {
00189         int i;
00190 
00191         // Disable all interrupts and set IVR to the default handler
00192         for (i = 0; i < 32; ++i) {
00193                 AT91F_AIC_DisableIt(pAic, i);
00194                 AT91F_AIC_ConfigureIt(pAic, i, AT91C_AIC_PRIOR_LOWEST, AT91C_AIC_SRCTYPE_HIGH_LEVEL, DefaultHandler);
00195         }
00196 
00197         // Set the IRQ exception vector
00198         AT91F_AIC_SetExceptionVector((unsigned int *) 0x18, IrqHandler);
00199         // Set the Fast Interrupt exception vector
00200         AT91F_AIC_SetExceptionVector((unsigned int *) 0x1C, FiqHandler);
00201 
00202         pAic->AIC_SPU = (unsigned int) SpuriousHandler;
00203         pAic->AIC_DCR = protectMode;
00204 }

00209 //* \fn    AT91F_PDC_SetNextRx
00210 //* \brief Set the next receive transfer descriptor
00211 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00212 __inline void AT91F_PDC_SetNextRx (
00213         AT91PS_PDC pPDC,     // \arg pointer to a PDC controller
00214         char *address,       // \arg address to the next bloc to be received
00215         unsigned int bytes)  // \arg number of bytes to be received
00216 {
00217         pPDC->PDC_RNPR = (unsigned int) address;
00218         pPDC->PDC_RNCR = bytes;
00219 }
00220 
00221 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00222 //* \fn    AT91F_PDC_SetNextTx
00223 //* \brief Set the next transmit transfer descriptor
00224 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00225 __inline void AT91F_PDC_SetNextTx (
00226         AT91PS_PDC pPDC,       // \arg pointer to a PDC controller
00227         char *address,         // \arg address to the next bloc to be transmitted
00228         unsigned int bytes)    // \arg number of bytes to be transmitted
00229 {
00230         pPDC->PDC_TNPR = (unsigned int) address;
00231         pPDC->PDC_TNCR = bytes;

00236 //* \brief Set the receive transfer descriptor

00239         AT91PS_PDC pPDC,       // \arg pointer to a PDC controller
00240         char *address,         // \arg address to the next bloc to be received
00241         unsigned int bytes)    // \arg number of bytes to be received
00242 {
00243         pPDC->PDC_RPR = (unsigned int) address;
00244         pPDC->PDC_RCR = bytes;
00245 }

00247 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00248 //* \fn    AT91F_PDC_SetTx
00249 //* \brief Set the transmit transfer descriptor

00251 __inline void AT91F_PDC_SetTx (
00252         AT91PS_PDC pPDC,       // \arg pointer to a PDC controller
00253         char *address,         // \arg address to the next bloc to be transmitted
00254         unsigned int bytes)    // \arg number of bytes to be transmitted
00255 {
00256         pPDC->PDC_TPR = (unsigned int) address;

00300 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00301 //* \fn    AT91F_PDC_IsTxEmpty
00302 //* \brief Test if the current transfer descriptor has been sent
00303 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00304 __inline int AT91F_PDC_IsTxEmpty ( // \return return 1 if transfer is complete
00305         AT91PS_PDC pPDC )       // \arg pointer to a PDC controller
00306 {
00307         return !(pPDC->PDC_TCR);
00308 }
00309 
00310 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00311 //* \fn    AT91F_PDC_IsNextTxEmpty
00312 //* \brief Test if the next transfer descriptor has been moved to the current td
00313 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00314 __inline int AT91F_PDC_IsNextTxEmpty ( // \return return 1 if transfer is complete
00315         AT91PS_PDC pPDC )       // \arg pointer to a PDC controller
00316 {
00317         return !(pPDC->PDC_TNCR);
00318 }
00319

00322 //* \brief Test if the current transfer descriptor has been filled
00323 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00324 __inline int AT91F_PDC_IsRxEmpty ( // \return return 1 if transfer is complete
00325         AT91PS_PDC pPDC )       // \arg pointer to a PDC controller
00326 {
00327         return !(pPDC->PDC_RCR);

00334 __inline int AT91F_PDC_IsNextRxEmpty ( // \return return 1 if transfer is complete
00335         AT91PS_PDC pPDC )       // \arg pointer to a PDC controller

00337         return !(pPDC->PDC_RNCR);
00338 }

00340 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00341 //* \fn    AT91F_PDC_Open
00342 //* \brief Open PDC: disable TX and RX reset transfer descriptors, re-enable RX and TX
00343 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00344 __inline void AT91F_PDC_Open (
00345         AT91PS_PDC pPDC)       // \arg pointer to a PDC controller
00346 {
00347     //* Disable the RX and TX PDC transfer requests
00348         AT91F_PDC_DisableRx(pPDC);
00349         AT91F_PDC_DisableTx(pPDC);
00350 
00351         //* Reset all Counter register Next buffer first
00352         AT91F_PDC_SetNextTx(pPDC, (char *) 0, 0);
00353         AT91F_PDC_SetNextRx(pPDC, (char *) 0, 0);
00354         AT91F_PDC_SetTx(pPDC, (char *) 0, 0);
00355         AT91F_PDC_SetRx(pPDC, (char *) 0, 0);
00356 
00357     //* Enable the RX and TX PDC transfer requests
00358         AT91F_PDC_EnableRx(pPDC);
00359         AT91F_PDC_EnableTx(pPDC);
00360 }
00361 
00362 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00363 //* \fn    AT91F_PDC_Close
00364 //* \brief Close PDC: disable TX and RX reset transfer descriptors
00365 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00366 __inline void AT91F_PDC_Close (
00367         AT91PS_PDC pPDC)       // \arg pointer to a PDC controller
00368 {
00369     //* Disable the RX and TX PDC transfer requests
00370         AT91F_PDC_DisableRx(pPDC);
00371         AT91F_PDC_DisableTx(pPDC);
00372 
00373         //* Reset all Counter register Next buffer first
00374         AT91F_PDC_SetNextTx(pPDC, (char *) 0, 0);
00375         AT91F_PDC_SetNextRx(pPDC, (char *) 0, 0);
00376         AT91F_PDC_SetTx(pPDC, (char *) 0, 0);
00377         AT91F_PDC_SetRx(pPDC, (char *) 0, 0);
00378 
00379 }
00380 
00381 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00382 //* \fn    AT91F_PDC_SendFrame
00383 //* \brief Close PDC: disable TX and RX reset transfer descriptors
00384 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00385 __inline unsigned int AT91F_PDC_SendFrame(
00386         AT91PS_PDC pPDC,
00387         char *pBuffer,
00388         unsigned int szBuffer,
00389         char *pNextBuffer,
00390         unsigned int szNextBuffer )
00391 {
00392         if (AT91F_PDC_IsTxEmpty(pPDC)) {
00393                 //* Buffer and next buffer can be initialized
00394                 AT91F_PDC_SetTx(pPDC, pBuffer, szBuffer);
00395                 AT91F_PDC_SetNextTx(pPDC, pNextBuffer, szNextBuffer);
00396                 return 2;
00397         }
00398         else if (AT91F_PDC_IsNextTxEmpty(pPDC)) {
00399                 //* Only one buffer can be initialized
00400                 AT91F_PDC_SetNextTx(pPDC, pBuffer, szBuffer);
00401                 return 1;
00402         }
00403         else {
00404                 //* All buffer are in use...
00405                 return 0;
00406         }
00407 }
00408 
00409 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00410 //* \fn    AT91F_PDC_ReceiveFrame
00411 //* \brief Close PDC: disable TX and RX reset transfer descriptors
00412 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00413 __inline unsigned int AT91F_PDC_ReceiveFrame (
00414         AT91PS_PDC pPDC,
00415         char *pBuffer,
00416         unsigned int szBuffer,
00417         char *pNextBuffer,
00418         unsigned int szNextBuffer )
00419 {
00420         if (AT91F_PDC_IsRxEmpty(pPDC)) {
00421                 //* Buffer and next buffer can be initialized
00422                 AT91F_PDC_SetRx(pPDC, pBuffer, szBuffer);
00423                 AT91F_PDC_SetNextRx(pPDC, pNextBuffer, szNextBuffer);
00424                 return 2;
00425         }
00426         else if (AT91F_PDC_IsNextRxEmpty(pPDC)) {
00427                 //* Only one buffer can be initialized
00428                 AT91F_PDC_SetNextRx(pPDC, pBuffer, szBuffer);
00429                 return 1;
00430         }
00431         else {
00432                 //* All buffer are in use...
00433                 return 0;
00434         }
00435 }

00471 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------

00476         AT91PS_DBGU pDbgu,   // \arg  pointer to a DBGU controller

00479         return (AT91F_DBGU_GetInterruptMaskStatus(pDbgu) & flag);

00485 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00486 //* \fn    AT91F_PIO_CfgPeriph
00487 //* \brief Enable pins to be drived by peripheral
00488 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00489 __inline void AT91F_PIO_CfgPeriph(
00490         AT91PS_PIO pPio,             // \arg pointer to a PIO controller
00491         unsigned int periphAEnable,  // \arg PERIPH A to enable
00492         unsigned int periphBEnable)  // \arg PERIPH B to enable
00493 
00494 {
00495         pPio->PIO_ASR = periphAEnable;
00496         pPio->PIO_BSR = periphBEnable;
00497         pPio->PIO_PDR = (periphAEnable | periphBEnable); // Set in Periph mode
00498 }
00499 
00500 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00501 //* \fn    AT91F_PIO_CfgOutput
00502 //* \brief Enable PIO in output mode
00503 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00504 __inline void AT91F_PIO_CfgOutput(
00505         AT91PS_PIO pPio,             // \arg pointer to a PIO controller
00506         unsigned int pioEnable)      // \arg PIO to be enabled
00507 {
00508         pPio->PIO_PER = pioEnable; // Set in PIO mode
00509         pPio->PIO_OER = pioEnable; // Configure in Output
00510 }
00511 
00512 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00513 //* \fn    AT91F_PIO_CfgInput
00514 //* \brief Enable PIO in input mode
00515 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00516 __inline void AT91F_PIO_CfgInput(
00517         AT91PS_PIO pPio,             // \arg pointer to a PIO controller
00518         unsigned int inputEnable)      // \arg PIO to be enabled
00519 {
00520         // Disable output
00521         pPio->PIO_ODR  = inputEnable;
00522         pPio->PIO_PER  = inputEnable;
00523 }
00524 
00525 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00526 //* \fn    AT91F_PIO_CfgOpendrain
00527 //* \brief Configure PIO in open drain
00528 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00529 __inline void AT91F_PIO_CfgOpendrain(
00530         AT91PS_PIO pPio,             // \arg pointer to a PIO controller
00531         unsigned int multiDrvEnable) // \arg pio to be configured in open drain
00532 {
00533         // Configure the multi-drive option
00534         pPio->PIO_MDDR = ~multiDrvEnable;
00535         pPio->PIO_MDER = multiDrvEnable;
00536 }

00538 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00539 //* \fn    AT91F_PIO_CfgPullup
00540 //* \brief Enable pullup on PIO
00541 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00542 __inline void AT91F_PIO_CfgPullup(
00543         AT91PS_PIO pPio,             // \arg pointer to a PIO controller
00544         unsigned int pullupEnable)   // \arg enable pullup on PIO
00545 {
00546                 // Connect or not Pullup
00547         pPio->PIO_PPUDR = ~pullupEnable;
00548         pPio->PIO_PPUER = pullupEnable;
00549 }

00551 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00552 //* \fn    AT91F_PIO_CfgDirectDrive
00553 //* \brief Enable direct drive on PIO
00554 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00555 __inline void AT91F_PIO_CfgDirectDrive(
00556         AT91PS_PIO pPio,             // \arg pointer to a PIO controller
00557         unsigned int directDrive)    // \arg PIO to be configured with direct drive
00558 
00559 {
00560         // Configure the Direct Drive
00561         pPio->PIO_OWDR  = ~directDrive;
00562         pPio->PIO_OWER  = directDrive;
00563 }
00564 
00565 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00566 //* \fn    AT91F_PIO_CfgInputFilter
00567 //* \brief Enable input filter on input PIO
00568 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00569 __inline void AT91F_PIO_CfgInputFilter(
00570         AT91PS_PIO pPio,             // \arg pointer to a PIO controller
00571         unsigned int inputFilter)    // \arg PIO to be configured with input filter
00572 
00573 {
00574         // Configure the Direct Drive
00575         pPio->PIO_IFDR  = ~inputFilter;
00576         pPio->PIO_IFER  = inputFilter;
00577 }
00578 
00579 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00580 //* \fn    AT91F_PIO_GetInput
00581 //* \brief Return PIO input value
00582 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00583 __inline unsigned int AT91F_PIO_GetInput( // \return PIO input
00584         AT91PS_PIO pPio) // \arg  pointer to a PIO controller
00585 {
00586         return pPio->PIO_PDSR;
00587 }
00588 
00589 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00590 //* \fn    AT91F_PIO_IsInputSet
00591 //* \brief Test if PIO is input flag is active
00592 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00593 __inline int AT91F_PIO_IsInputSet(
00594         AT91PS_PIO pPio,   // \arg  pointer to a PIO controller
00595         unsigned int flag) // \arg  flag to be tested
00596 {
00597         return (AT91F_PIO_GetInput(pPio) & flag);
00598 }
00599 
00600

00603 //* \brief Set to 1 output PIO
00604 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00605 __inline void AT91F_PIO_SetOutput(
00606         AT91PS_PIO pPio,   // \arg  pointer to a PIO controller
00607         unsigned int flag) // \arg  output to be set
00608 {
00609         pPio->PIO_SODR = flag;
00610 }
00611

00617         AT91PS_PIO pPio,   // \arg  pointer to a PIO controller
00618         unsigned int flag) // \arg  output to be cleared
00619 {
00620         pPio->PIO_CODR = flag;
00621 }

00998 /* *****************************************************************************
00999                 SOFTWARE API FOR PMC
01000    ***************************************************************************** */
01001 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01002 //* \fn    AT91F_PMC_CfgSysClkEnableReg
01003 //* \brief Configure the System Clock Enable Register of the PMC controller
01004 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01005 __inline void AT91F_PMC_CfgSysClkEnableReg (
01006         AT91PS_PMC pPMC, // \arg pointer to PMC controller
01007         unsigned int mode)
01008 {
01009         //* Write to the SCER register
01010         pPMC->PMC_SCER = mode;
01011 }
01012 
01013 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01014 //* \fn    AT91F_PMC_CfgSysClkDisableReg
01015 //* \brief Configure the System Clock Disable Register of the PMC controller
01016 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01017 __inline void AT91F_PMC_CfgSysClkDisableReg (
01018         AT91PS_PMC pPMC, // \arg pointer to PMC controller
01019         unsigned int mode)
01020 {
01021         //* Write to the SCDR register
01022         pPMC->PMC_SCDR = mode;
01023 }
01024 
01025 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01026 //* \fn    AT91F_PMC_GetSysClkStatusReg
01027 //* \brief Return the System Clock Status Register of the PMC controller
01028 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01029 __inline unsigned int AT91F_PMC_GetSysClkStatusReg (
01030         AT91PS_PMC pPMC // pointer to a CAN controller
01031         )
01032 {
01033         return pPMC->PMC_SCSR;
01034 }
01035 
01036 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01037 //* \fn    AT91F_PMC_EnablePeriphClock
01038 //* \brief Enable peripheral clock
01039 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01040 __inline void AT91F_PMC_EnablePeriphClock (
01041         AT91PS_PMC pPMC, // \arg pointer to PMC controller
01042         unsigned int periphIds)  // \arg IDs of peripherals
01043 {
01044         pPMC->PMC_PCER = periphIds;
01045 }
01046 
01047 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01048 //* \fn    AT91F_PMC_DisablePeriphClock
01049 //* \brief Disable peripheral clock
01050 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01051 __inline void AT91F_PMC_DisablePeriphClock (
01052         AT91PS_PMC pPMC, // \arg pointer to PMC controller
01053         unsigned int periphIds)  // \arg IDs of peripherals
01054 {
01055         pPMC->PMC_PCDR = periphIds;
01056 }
01057 
01058 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01059 //* \fn    AT91F_PMC_GetPeriphClock
01060 //* \brief Get peripheral clock status
01061 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01062 __inline unsigned int AT91F_PMC_GetPeriphClock (
01063         AT91PS_PMC pPMC) // \arg pointer to PMC controller
01064 {
01065         return pPMC->PMC_PCSR;
01066 }
01067 
01068 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01069 //* \fn    AT91F_CKGR_CfgMainOscillatorReg
01070 //* \brief Cfg the main oscillator
01071 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01072 __inline void AT91F_CKGR_CfgMainOscillatorReg (
01073         AT91PS_CKGR pCKGR, // \arg pointer to CKGR controller
01074         unsigned int mode)
01075 {
01076         pCKGR->CKGR_MOR = mode;
01077 }
01078 
01079 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01080 //* \fn    AT91F_CKGR_GetMainOscillatorReg
01081 //* \brief Cfg the main oscillator
01082 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01083 __inline unsigned int AT91F_CKGR_GetMainOscillatorReg (
01084         AT91PS_CKGR pCKGR) // \arg pointer to CKGR controller
01085 {
01086         return pCKGR->CKGR_MOR;
01087 }
01088 
01089 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01090 //* \fn    AT91F_CKGR_EnableMainOscillator
01091 //* \brief Enable the main oscillator
01092 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01093 __inline void AT91F_CKGR_EnableMainOscillator(
01094         AT91PS_CKGR pCKGR) // \arg pointer to CKGR controller
01095 {
01096         pCKGR->CKGR_MOR |= AT91C_CKGR_MOSCEN;
01097 }
01098 
01099 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01100 //* \fn    AT91F_CKGR_DisableMainOscillator
01101 //* \brief Disable the main oscillator
01102 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01103 __inline void AT91F_CKGR_DisableMainOscillator (
01104         AT91PS_CKGR pCKGR) // \arg pointer to CKGR controller
01105 {
01106         pCKGR->CKGR_MOR &= ~AT91C_CKGR_MOSCEN;
01107 }
01108 
01109 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01110 //* \fn    AT91F_CKGR_CfgMainOscStartUpTime
01111 //* \brief Cfg MOR Register according to the main osc startup time
01112 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01113 __inline void AT91F_CKGR_CfgMainOscStartUpTime (
01114         AT91PS_CKGR pCKGR, // \arg pointer to CKGR controller
01115         unsigned int startup_time,  // \arg main osc startup time in microsecond (us)
01116         unsigned int slowClock)  // \arg slowClock in Hz
01117 {
01118         pCKGR->CKGR_MOR &= ~AT91C_CKGR_OSCOUNT;
01119         pCKGR->CKGR_MOR |= ((slowClock * startup_time)/(8*1000000)) << 8;
01120 }
01121 
01122 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01123 //* \fn    AT91F_CKGR_GetMainClockFreqReg
01124 //* \brief Cfg the main oscillator
01125 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01126 __inline unsigned int AT91F_CKGR_GetMainClockFreqReg (
01127         AT91PS_CKGR pCKGR) // \arg pointer to CKGR controller
01128 {
01129         return pCKGR->CKGR_MCFR;
01130 }
01131 
01132 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01133 //* \fn    AT91F_CKGR_GetMainClock
01134 //* \brief Return Main clock in Hz
01135 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01136 __inline unsigned int AT91F_CKGR_GetMainClock (
01137         AT91PS_CKGR pCKGR, // \arg pointer to CKGR controller
01138         unsigned int slowClock)  // \arg slowClock in Hz
01139 {
01140         return ((pCKGR->CKGR_MCFR  & AT91C_CKGR_MAINF) * slowClock) >> 4;
01141 }
01142 
01143 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01144 //* \fn    AT91F_PMC_CfgMCKReg
01145 //* \brief Cfg Master Clock Register
01146 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01147 __inline void AT91F_PMC_CfgMCKReg (
01148         AT91PS_PMC pPMC, // \arg pointer to PMC controller
01149         unsigned int mode)
01150 {
01151         pPMC->PMC_MCKR = mode;
01152 }
01153 
01154 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01155 //* \fn    AT91F_PMC_GetMCKReg
01156 //* \brief Return Master Clock Register
01157 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01158 __inline unsigned int AT91F_PMC_GetMCKReg(
01159         AT91PS_PMC pPMC) // \arg pointer to PMC controller
01160 {
01161         return pPMC->PMC_MCKR;
01162 }
01163 
01164 //*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01165 //* \fn    AT91F_PMC_GetMasterClock
01166 //* \brief Return master clock in Hz which correponds to processor clock for ARM7
01167 //*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01168 __inline unsigned int AT91F_PMC_GetMasterClock (
01169         AT91PS_PMC pPMC, // \arg pointer to PMC controller
01170         AT91PS_CKGR pCKGR, // \arg pointer to CKGR controller
01171         unsigned int slowClock)  // \arg slowClock in Hz
01172 {
01173         unsigned int reg = pPMC->PMC_MCKR;
01174         unsigned int prescaler = (1 << ((reg & AT91C_PMC_PRES) >> 2));
01175         unsigned int pllDivider, pllMultiplier;
01176 
01177         switch (reg & AT91C_PMC_CSS) {
01178                 case AT91C_PMC_CSS_SLOW_CLK: // Slow clock selected
01179                         return slowClock / prescaler;
01180                 case AT91C_PMC_CSS_MAIN_CLK: // Main clock is selected
01181                         return AT91F_CKGR_GetMainClock(pCKGR, slowClock) / prescaler;
01182                 case AT91C_PMC_CSS_PLL_CLK: // PLLB clock is selected
01183                         reg = pCKGR->CKGR_PLLR;
01184                         pllDivider    = (reg  & AT91C_CKGR_DIV);
01185                         pllMultiplier = ((reg  & AT91C_CKGR_MUL) >> 16) + 1;
01186                         return AT91F_CKGR_GetMainClock(pCKGR, slowClock) / pllDivider * pllMultiplier / prescaler;
01187         }
01188         return 0;
01189 }
01190 
01191 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01192 //* \fn    AT91F_PMC_EnablePCK
01193 //* \brief Enable Programmable Clock x Output
01194 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01195 __inline void AT91F_PMC_EnablePCK (
01196         AT91PS_PMC pPMC, // \arg pointer to PMC controller
01197         unsigned int pck,  // \arg Programmable Clock x Output
01198         unsigned int mode)
01199 {
01200         pPMC->PMC_PCKR[pck] = mode;
01201         pPMC->PMC_SCER = (1 << pck) << 8;
01202 }
01203 
01204 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01205 //* \fn    AT91F_PMC_DisablePCK
01206 //* \brief Disable Programmable Clock x Output
01207 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01208 __inline void AT91F_PMC_DisablePCK (
01209         AT91PS_PMC pPMC, // \arg pointer to PMC controller
01210         unsigned int pck)  // \arg Programmable Clock x Output
01211 {
01212         pPMC->PMC_SCDR = (1 << pck) << 8;
01213 }
01214 
01215 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01216 //* \fn    AT91F_PMC_EnableIt
01217 //* \brief Enable PMC interrupt
01218 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01219 __inline void AT91F_PMC_EnableIt (
01220         AT91PS_PMC pPMC,     // pointer to a PMC controller
01221         unsigned int flag)   // IT to be enabled
01222 {
01223         //* Write to the IER register
01224         pPMC->PMC_IER = flag;
01225 }
01226 
01227 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01228 //* \fn    AT91F_PMC_DisableIt
01229 //* \brief Disable PMC interrupt
01230 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01231 __inline void AT91F_PMC_DisableIt (
01232         AT91PS_PMC pPMC, // pointer to a PMC controller
01233         unsigned int flag) // IT to be disabled
01234 {
01235         //* Write to the IDR register
01236         pPMC->PMC_IDR = flag;
01237 }
01238 
01239 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------

01358 /* *****************************************************************************
01359                 SOFTWARE API FOR RTTC
01360    ***************************************************************************** */
01361 //*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01362 //* \fn     AT91F_SetRTT_TimeBase()
01363 //* \brief  Set the RTT prescaler according to the TimeBase in ms
01364 //*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01365 __inline unsigned int AT91F_RTTSetTimeBase(
01366         AT91PS_RTTC pRTTC, 
01367         unsigned int ms)
01368 {
01369         if (ms > 2000)
01370                 return 1;   // AT91C_TIME_OUT_OF_RANGE
01371         pRTTC->RTTC_RTMR &= ~0xFFFF;    
01372         pRTTC->RTTC_RTMR |= (((ms << 15) /1000) & 0xFFFF);      
01373         return 0;
01374 }
01375 
01376 //*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01377 //* \fn     AT91F_RTTSetPrescaler()
01378 //* \brief  Set the new prescaler value
01379 //*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01380 __inline unsigned int AT91F_RTTSetPrescaler(
01381         AT91PS_RTTC pRTTC, 
01382         unsigned int rtpres)
01383 {
01384         pRTTC->RTTC_RTMR &= ~0xFFFF;    
01385         pRTTC->RTTC_RTMR |= (rtpres & 0xFFFF);  
01386         return (pRTTC->RTTC_RTMR);
01387 }
01388 
01389 //*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01390 //* \fn     AT91F_RTTRestart()
01391 //* \brief  Restart the RTT prescaler
01392 //*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01393 __inline void AT91F_RTTRestart(
01394         AT91PS_RTTC pRTTC)
01395 {
01396         pRTTC->RTTC_RTMR |= AT91C_RTTC_RTTRST;  
01397 }
01398 
01399 
01400 //*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01401 //* \fn     AT91F_RTT_SetAlarmINT()

01403 //*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01404 __inline void AT91F_RTTSetAlarmINT(
01405         AT91PS_RTTC pRTTC)

01418 }

01460 //*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01461 //* \fn     AT91F_RTTGetStatus()
01462 //* \brief  Read the RTT status
01463 //*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01464 __inline unsigned int AT91F_RTTGetStatus(
01465         AT91PS_RTTC pRTTC)

01467         return(pRTTC->RTTC_RTSR);

01469 
01470 //*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01471 //* \fn     AT91F_RTT_ReadValue()
01472 //* \brief  Read the RTT value
01473 //*--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
01474 __inline unsigned int AT91F_RTTReadValue(
01475         AT91PS_RTTC pRTTC)
01476 {
01477         register volatile unsigned int val1,val2;
01478         do
01479         {
01480                 val1 = pRTTC->RTTC_RTVR;
01481                 val2 = pRTTC->RTTC_RTVR;
01482         }       
01483         while(val1 != val2);
01484         return(val1);
01485 }
01486 /* *****************************************************************************
01487                 SOFTWARE API FOR PITC
01488    ***************************************************************************** */
01489 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01490 //* \fn    AT91F_PITInit
01491 //* \brief System timer init : period in second, system clock freq in MHz
01492 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01493 __inline void AT91F_PITInit(
01494         AT91PS_PITC pPITC,
01495         unsigned int period,
01496         unsigned int pit_frequency)
01497 {
01498         pPITC->PITC_PIMR = period? (period * pit_frequency + 8) >> 4 : 0; // +8 to avoid %10 and /10
01499         pPITC->PITC_PIMR |= AT91C_PITC_PITEN;    
01500 }
01501 
01502 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01503 //* \fn    AT91F_PITSetPIV
01504 //* \brief Set the PIT Periodic Interval Value 
01505 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01506 __inline void AT91F_PITSetPIV(
01507         AT91PS_PITC pPITC,
01508         unsigned int piv)
01509 {
01510         pPITC->PITC_PIMR = piv | (pPITC->PITC_PIMR & (AT91C_PITC_PITEN | AT91C_PITC_PITIEN));
01511 }
01512 
01513 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01514 //* \fn    AT91F_PITEnableInt
01515 //* \brief Enable PIT periodic interrupt
01516 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01517 __inline void AT91F_PITEnableInt(
01518         AT91PS_PITC pPITC)
01519 {
01520         pPITC->PITC_PIMR |= AT91C_PITC_PITIEN;   
01521 }
01522 
01523 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01524 //* \fn    AT91F_PITDisableInt
01525 //* \brief Disable PIT periodic interrupt
01526 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01527 __inline void AT91F_PITDisableInt(
01528         AT91PS_PITC pPITC)
01529 {
01530         pPITC->PITC_PIMR &= ~AT91C_PITC_PITIEN;  
01531 }
01532 
01533 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------

01589 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------

01596 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01597 //* \fn    AT91F_WDTSGettatus
01598 //* \brief Get Watchdog Status
01599 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01600 __inline unsigned int AT91F_WDTSGettatus(
01601         AT91PS_WDTC pWDTC)
01602 {
01603         return(pWDTC->WDTC_WDSR & 0x3);
01604 }
01605 
01606 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01607 //* \fn    AT91F_WDTGetPeriod
01608 //* \brief Translate ms into Watchdog Compatible value
01609 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01610 __inline unsigned int AT91F_WDTGetPeriod(unsigned int ms)
01611 {
01612         if ((ms < 4) || (ms > 16000))
01613                 return 0;
01614         return((ms << 8) / 1000);
01615 }

01641 #define AT91C_MC_CORRECT_KEY  ((unsigned int) 0x5A << 24) // (MC) Correct Protect Key
01642 
01643 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01644 //* \fn    AT91F_MC_Remap
01645 //* \brief Make Remap
01646 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01647 __inline void AT91F_MC_Remap (void)     //  
01648 {
01649     AT91PS_MC pMC = (AT91PS_MC) AT91C_BASE_MC;
01650     
01651     pMC->MC_RCR = AT91C_MC_RCB;
01652 }

01659         AT91PS_MC pMC, // pointer to a MC controller
01660         unsigned int mode)        // mode register 
01661 {

01663         pMC->MC_FMR = mode;
01664 }

01674 }

01676 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------

01679 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01680 __inline unsigned int AT91F_MC_EFC_ComputeFMCN(
01681         int master_clock) // master clock in Hz
01682 {
01683         return (master_clock/1000000 +2);
01684 }

01695 }

01734 //* \brief Configure SPI chip select register
01735 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01736 __inline void AT91F_SPI_CfgCs (
01737         AT91PS_SPI pSPI,     // pointer to a SPI controller
01738         int cs,     // SPI cs number (0 to 3)
01739         int val)   //  chip select register
01740 {
01741         //* Write to the CSR register
01742         *(pSPI->SPI_CSR + cs) = val;
01743 }

01751         unsigned int flag)   // IT to be enabled
01752 {
01753         //* Write to the IER register
01754         pSPI->SPI_IER = flag;
01755 }

01762         AT91PS_SPI pSPI, // pointer to a SPI controller
01763         unsigned int flag) // IT to be disabled
01764 {

01775         )

01791 }

01793 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------

01795 //* \brief Disable the SPI controller

01798         AT91PS_SPI pSPI // pointer to a SPI controller
01799         )
01800 {
01801         //* Write to the CR register
01802         pSPI->SPI_CR = AT91C_SPI_SPIDIS;
01803 }

01808 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01809 __inline void AT91F_SPI_CfgMode (
01810         AT91PS_SPI pSPI, // pointer to a SPI controller

01813         //* Write to the MR register
01814         pSPI->SPI_MR = mode;
01815 }

01817 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01818 //* \fn    AT91F_SPI_CfgPCS
01819 //* \brief Switch to the correct PCS of SPI Mode Register : Fixed Peripheral Selected
01820 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01821 __inline void AT91F_SPI_CfgPCS (
01822         AT91PS_SPI pSPI, // pointer to a SPI controller
01823         char PCS_Device) // PCS of the Device
01824 {       
01825         //* Write to the MR register
01826         pSPI->SPI_MR &= 0xFFF0FFFF;
01827         pSPI->SPI_MR |= ( (PCS_Device<<16) & AT91C_SPI_PCS );
01828 }
01829 
01830 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01831 //* \fn    AT91F_SPI_ReceiveFrame
01832 //* \brief Return 2 if PDC has been initialized with Buffer and Next Buffer, 1 if PDC has been initializaed with Next Buffer, 0 if PDC is busy
01833 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01834 __inline unsigned int AT91F_SPI_ReceiveFrame (
01835         AT91PS_SPI pSPI,
01836         char *pBuffer,
01837         unsigned int szBuffer,
01838         char *pNextBuffer,
01839         unsigned int szNextBuffer )
01840 {
01841         return AT91F_PDC_ReceiveFrame(
01842                 (AT91PS_PDC) &(pSPI->SPI_RPR),
01843                 pBuffer,
01844                 szBuffer,
01845                 pNextBuffer,
01846                 szNextBuffer);
01847 }
01848 
01849 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01850 //* \fn    AT91F_SPI_SendFrame
01851 //* \brief Return 2 if PDC has been initialized with Buffer and Next Buffer, 1 if PDC has been initializaed with Next Buffer, 0 if PDC is bSPIy
01852 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01853 __inline unsigned int AT91F_SPI_SendFrame(
01854         AT91PS_SPI pSPI,
01855         char *pBuffer,
01856         unsigned int szBuffer,
01857         char *pNextBuffer,
01858         unsigned int szNextBuffer )
01859 {
01860         return AT91F_PDC_SendFrame(
01861                 (AT91PS_PDC) &(pSPI->SPI_RPR),
01862                 pBuffer,
01863                 szBuffer,
01864                 pNextBuffer,
01865                 szNextBuffer);
01866 }
01867 
01868 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01869 //* \fn    AT91F_SPI_Close
01870 //* \brief Close SPI: disable IT disable transfert, close PDC
01871 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01872 __inline void AT91F_SPI_Close (
01873         AT91PS_SPI pSPI)     // \arg pointer to a SPI controller
01874 {
01875     //* Reset all the Chip Select register
01876     pSPI->SPI_CSR[0] = 0 ;
01877     pSPI->SPI_CSR[1] = 0 ;
01878     pSPI->SPI_CSR[2] = 0 ;
01879     pSPI->SPI_CSR[3] = 0 ;
01880 
01881     //* Reset the SPI mode
01882     pSPI->SPI_MR = 0  ;
01883 
01884     //* Disable all interrupts
01885     pSPI->SPI_IDR = 0xFFFFFFFF ;
01886 
01887     //* Abort the Peripheral Data Transfers
01888     AT91F_PDC_Close((AT91PS_PDC) &(pSPI->SPI_RPR));
01889 
01890     //* Disable receiver and transmitter and stop any activity immediately
01891     pSPI->SPI_CR = AT91C_SPI_SPIDIS;
01892 }
01893 
01894 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01895 //* \fn    AT91F_SPI_PutChar
01896 //* \brief Send a character,does not check if ready to send
01897 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01898 __inline void AT91F_SPI_PutChar (
01899         AT91PS_SPI pSPI,
01900         unsigned int character,
01901              unsigned int cs_number )
01902 {
01903     unsigned int value_for_cs;
01904     value_for_cs = (~(1 << cs_number)) & 0xF;  //Place a zero among a 4 ONEs number
01905     pSPI->SPI_TDR = (character & 0xFFFF) | (value_for_cs << 16);
01906 }
01907 
01908 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01909 //* \fn    AT91F_SPI_GetChar
01910 //* \brief Receive a character,does not check if a character is available
01911 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01912 __inline int AT91F_SPI_GetChar (
01913         const AT91PS_SPI pSPI)
01914 {
01915     return((pSPI->SPI_RDR) & 0xFFFF);
01916 }
01917 
01918 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01919 //* \fn    AT91F_SPI_GetInterruptMaskStatus
01920 //* \brief Return SPI Interrupt Mask Status
01921 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01922 __inline unsigned int AT91F_SPI_GetInterruptMaskStatus( // \return SPI Interrupt Mask Status
01923         AT91PS_SPI pSpi) // \arg  pointer to a SPI controller
01924 {
01925         return pSpi->SPI_IMR;
01926 }
01927 
01928 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01929 //* \fn    AT91F_SPI_IsInterruptMasked
01930 //* \brief Test if SPI Interrupt is Masked 
01931 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01932 __inline int AT91F_SPI_IsInterruptMasked(
01933         AT91PS_SPI pSpi,   // \arg  pointer to a SPI controller
01934         unsigned int flag) // \arg  flag to be tested
01935 {
01936         return (AT91F_SPI_GetInterruptMaskStatus(pSpi) & flag);
01937 }

02008 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02009 //* \fn    AT91F_ADC_CfgModeReg
02010 //* \brief Configure the Mode Register of the ADC controller
02011 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02012 __inline void AT91F_ADC_CfgModeReg (
02013         AT91PS_ADC pADC, // pointer to a ADC controller
02014         unsigned int mode)        // mode register 
02015 {
02016         //* Write to the MR register
02017         pADC->ADC_MR = mode;
02018 }
02019 
02020 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02021 //* \fn    AT91F_ADC_GetModeReg
02022 //* \brief Return the Mode Register of the ADC controller value
02023 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02024 __inline unsigned int AT91F_ADC_GetModeReg (
02025         AT91PS_ADC pADC // pointer to a ADC controller
02026         )
02027 {
02028         return pADC->ADC_MR;    
02029 }
02030 
02031 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02032 //* \fn    AT91F_ADC_CfgTimings
02033 //* \brief Configure the different necessary timings of the ADC controller
02034 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02035 __inline void AT91F_ADC_CfgTimings (
02036         AT91PS_ADC pADC, // pointer to a ADC controller
02037         unsigned int mck_clock, // in MHz 
02038         unsigned int adc_clock, // in MHz 
02039         unsigned int startup_time, // in us 
02040         unsigned int sample_and_hold_time)      // in ns  
02041 {
02042         unsigned int prescal,startup,shtim;
02043         
02044         prescal = mck_clock/(2*adc_clock) - 1;
02045         startup = adc_clock*startup_time/8 - 1;
02046         shtim = adc_clock*sample_and_hold_time/1000 - 1;
02047         
02048         //* Write to the MR register
02049         pADC->ADC_MR = ( (prescal<<8) & AT91C_ADC_PRESCAL) | ( (startup<<16) & AT91C_ADC_STARTUP) | ( (shtim<<24) & AT91C_ADC_SHTIM);
02050 }
02051

02208 /* *****************************************************************************
02209                 SOFTWARE API FOR SSC
02210    ***************************************************************************** */
02211 //* Define the standard I2S mode configuration
02212 
02213 //* Configuration to set in the SSC Transmit Clock Mode Register
02214 //* Parameters :  nb_bit_by_slot : 8, 16 or 32 bits
02215 //*                       nb_slot_by_frame : number of channels
02216 #define AT91C_I2S_ASY_MASTER_TX_SETTING(nb_bit_by_slot, nb_slot_by_frame)( +\
02217                                                                            AT91C_SSC_CKS_DIV   +\
02218                                            AT91C_SSC_CKO_CONTINOUS      +\
02219                                            AT91C_SSC_CKG_NONE    +\
02220                                        AT91C_SSC_START_FALL_RF +\
02221                                                    AT91C_SSC_STTOUT  +\
02222                                            ((1<<16) & AT91C_SSC_STTDLY) +\
02223                                            ((((nb_bit_by_slot*nb_slot_by_frame)/2)-1) <<24))
02224 
02225 
02226 //* Configuration to set in the SSC Transmit Frame Mode Register
02227 //* Parameters : nb_bit_by_slot : 8, 16 or 32 bits
02228 //*                      nb_slot_by_frame : number of channels
02229 #define AT91C_I2S_ASY_TX_FRAME_SETTING(nb_bit_by_slot, nb_slot_by_frame)( +\
02230                                                                         (nb_bit_by_slot-1)  +\
02231                                         AT91C_SSC_MSBF   +\
02232                                         (((nb_slot_by_frame-1)<<8) & AT91C_SSC_DATNB)  +\
02233                                         (((nb_bit_by_slot-1)<<16) & AT91C_SSC_FSLEN) +\
02234                                         AT91C_SSC_FSOS_NEGATIVE)
02235 
02236 
02237 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02238 //* \fn    AT91F_SSC_SetBaudrate
02239 //* \brief Set the baudrate according to the CPU clock
02240 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02241 __inline void AT91F_SSC_SetBaudrate (
02242         AT91PS_SSC pSSC,        // \arg pointer to a SSC controller
02243         unsigned int mainClock, // \arg peripheral clock
02244         unsigned int speed)     // \arg SSC baudrate
02245 {
02246         unsigned int baud_value;
02247         //* Define the baud rate divisor register
02248         if (speed == 0)
02249            baud_value = 0;
02250         else
02251         {
02252            baud_value = (unsigned int) (mainClock * 10)/(2*speed);
02253            if ((baud_value % 10) >= 5)
02254                   baud_value = (baud_value / 10) + 1;
02255            else
02256                   baud_value /= 10;
02257         }
02258 
02259         pSSC->SSC_CMR = baud_value;
02260 }
02261 
02262 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02263 //* \fn    AT91F_SSC_Configure
02264 //* \brief Configure SSC
02265 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02266 __inline void AT91F_SSC_Configure (
02267              AT91PS_SSC pSSC,          // \arg pointer to a SSC controller
02268              unsigned int syst_clock,  // \arg System Clock Frequency
02269              unsigned int baud_rate,   // \arg Expected Baud Rate Frequency
02270              unsigned int clock_rx,    // \arg Receiver Clock Parameters
02271              unsigned int mode_rx,     // \arg mode Register to be programmed
02272              unsigned int clock_tx,    // \arg Transmitter Clock Parameters
02273              unsigned int mode_tx)     // \arg mode Register to be programmed
02274 {
02275     //* Disable interrupts
02276         pSSC->SSC_IDR = (unsigned int) -1;
02277 
02278     //* Reset receiver and transmitter
02279         pSSC->SSC_CR = AT91C_SSC_SWRST | AT91C_SSC_RXDIS | AT91C_SSC_TXDIS ;
02280 
02281     //* Define the Clock Mode Register
02282         AT91F_SSC_SetBaudrate(pSSC, syst_clock, baud_rate);
02283 
02284      //* Write the Receive Clock Mode Register
02285         pSSC->SSC_RCMR =  clock_rx;
02286 
02287      //* Write the Transmit Clock Mode Register
02288         pSSC->SSC_TCMR =  clock_tx;
02289 
02290      //* Write the Receive Frame Mode Register
02291         pSSC->SSC_RFMR =  mode_rx;
02292 
02293      //* Write the Transmit Frame Mode Register
02294         pSSC->SSC_TFMR =  mode_tx;
02295 
02296     //* Clear Transmit and Receive Counters
02297         AT91F_PDC_Open((AT91PS_PDC) &(pSSC->SSC_RPR));
02298 
02299 
02300 }
02301 
02302 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02303 //* \fn    AT91F_SSC_EnableRx
02304 //* \brief Enable receiving datas
02305 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02306 __inline void AT91F_SSC_EnableRx (
02307         AT91PS_SSC pSSC)     // \arg pointer to a SSC controller

02310     pSSC->SSC_CR = AT91C_SSC_RXEN;

02429 /* *****************************************************************************
02430                 SOFTWARE API FOR USART
02431    ***************************************************************************** */
02432 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02433 //* \fn    AT91F_US_Baudrate
02434 //* \brief Calculate the baudrate
02435 //* Standard Asynchronous Mode : 8 bits , 1 stop , no parity
02436 #define AT91C_US_ASYNC_MODE ( AT91C_US_USMODE_NORMAL + \
02437                         AT91C_US_NBSTOP_1_BIT + \
02438                         AT91C_US_PAR_NONE + \
02439                         AT91C_US_CHRL_8_BITS + \
02440                         AT91C_US_CLKS_CLOCK )
02441 
02442 //* Standard External Asynchronous Mode : 8 bits , 1 stop , no parity
02443 #define AT91C_US_ASYNC_SCK_MODE ( AT91C_US_USMODE_NORMAL + \
02444                             AT91C_US_NBSTOP_1_BIT + \
02445                             AT91C_US_PAR_NONE + \
02446                             AT91C_US_CHRL_8_BITS + \
02447                             AT91C_US_CLKS_EXT )
02448 
02449 //* Standard Synchronous Mode : 8 bits , 1 stop , no parity
02450 #define AT91C_US_SYNC_MODE ( AT91C_US_SYNC + \
02451                        AT91C_US_USMODE_NORMAL + \
02452                        AT91C_US_NBSTOP_1_BIT + \
02453                        AT91C_US_PAR_NONE + \
02454                        AT91C_US_CHRL_8_BITS + \
02455                        AT91C_US_CLKS_CLOCK )
02456 
02457 //* SCK used Label
02458 #define AT91C_US_SCK_USED (AT91C_US_CKLO | AT91C_US_CLKS_EXT)
02459 
02460 //* Standard ISO T=0 Mode : 8 bits , 1 stop , parity
02461 #define AT91C_US_ISO_READER_MODE ( AT91C_US_USMODE_ISO7816_0 + \
02462                                                          AT91C_US_CLKS_CLOCK +\
02463                                  AT91C_US_NBSTOP_1_BIT + \
02464                                  AT91C_US_PAR_EVEN + \
02465                                  AT91C_US_CHRL_8_BITS + \
02466                                  AT91C_US_CKLO +\
02467                                  AT91C_US_OVER)
02468 
02469 //* Standard IRDA mode
02470 #define AT91C_US_ASYNC_IRDA_MODE (  AT91C_US_USMODE_IRDA + \
02471                             AT91C_US_NBSTOP_1_BIT + \
02472                             AT91C_US_PAR_NONE + \
02473                             AT91C_US_CHRL_8_BITS + \
02474                             AT91C_US_CLKS_CLOCK )
02475 
02476 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02477 //* \fn    AT91F_US_Baudrate
02478 //* \brief Caluculate baud_value according to the main clock and the baud rate
02479 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02480 __inline unsigned int AT91F_US_Baudrate (
02481         const unsigned int main_clock, // \arg peripheral clock
02482         const unsigned int baud_rate)  // \arg UART baudrate
02483 {
02484         unsigned int baud_value = ((main_clock*10)/(baud_rate * 16));
02485         if ((baud_value % 10) >= 5)
02486                 baud_value = (baud_value / 10) + 1;
02487         else
02488                 baud_value /= 10;
02489         return baud_value;
02490 }
02491 
02492 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02493 //* \fn    AT91F_US_SetBaudrate
02494 //* \brief Set the baudrate according to the CPU clock
02495 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02496 __inline void AT91F_US_SetBaudrate (
02497         AT91PS_USART pUSART,    // \arg pointer to a USART controller
02498         unsigned int mainClock, // \arg peripheral clock
02499         unsigned int speed)     // \arg UART baudrate
02500 {
02501         //* Define the baud rate divisor register
02502         pUSART->US_BRGR = AT91F_US_Baudrate(mainClock, speed);
02503 }
02504 
02505 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02506 //* \fn    AT91F_US_SetTimeguard
02507 //* \brief Set USART timeguard
02508 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02509 __inline void AT91F_US_SetTimeguard (
02510         AT91PS_USART pUSART,    // \arg pointer to a USART controller
02511         unsigned int timeguard) // \arg timeguard value
02512 {
02513         //* Write the Timeguard Register
02514         pUSART->US_TTGR = timeguard ;
02515 }
02516 
02517 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02518 //* \fn    AT91F_US_EnableIt
02519 //* \brief Enable USART IT
02520 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02521 __inline void AT91F_US_EnableIt (
02522         AT91PS_USART pUSART, // \arg pointer to a USART controller
02523         unsigned int flag)   // \arg IT to be enabled
02524 {
02525         //* Write to the IER register
02526         pUSART->US_IER = flag;
02527 }
02528 
02529 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02530 //* \fn    AT91F_US_DisableIt
02531 //* \brief Disable USART IT
02532 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02533 __inline void AT91F_US_DisableIt (
02534         AT91PS_USART pUSART, // \arg pointer to a USART controller
02535         unsigned int flag)   // \arg IT to be disabled
02536 {
02537         //* Write to the IER register
02538         pUSART->US_IDR = flag;
02539 }
02540 
02541 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02542 //* \fn    AT91F_US_Configure
02543 //* \brief Configure USART
02544 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02545 __inline void AT91F_US_Configure (
02546         AT91PS_USART pUSART,     // \arg pointer to a USART controller
02547         unsigned int mainClock,  // \arg peripheral clock
02548         unsigned int mode ,      // \arg mode Register to be programmed
02549         unsigned int baudRate ,  // \arg baudrate to be programmed
02550         unsigned int timeguard ) // \arg timeguard to be programmed
02551 {
02552     //* Disable interrupts
02553     pUSART->US_IDR = (unsigned int) -1;
02554 
02555     //* Reset receiver and transmitter
02556     pUSART->US_CR = AT91C_US_RSTRX | AT91C_US_RSTTX | AT91C_US_RXDIS | AT91C_US_TXDIS ;
02557 
02558         //* Define the baud rate divisor register
02559         AT91F_US_SetBaudrate(pUSART, mainClock, baudRate);
02560 
02561         //* Write the Timeguard Register
02562         AT91F_US_SetTimeguard(pUSART, timeguard);
02563 
02564     //* Clear Transmit and Receive Counters
02565     AT91F_PDC_Open((AT91PS_PDC) &(pUSART->US_RPR));
02566 
02567     //* Define the USART mode
02568     pUSART->US_MR = mode  ;
02569 
02570 }
02571 
02572 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02573 //* \fn    AT91F_US_EnableRx
02574 //* \brief Enable receiving characters
02575 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02576 __inline void AT91F_US_EnableRx (
02577         AT91PS_USART pUSART)     // \arg pointer to a USART controller
02578 {
02579     //* Enable receiver
02580     pUSART->US_CR = AT91C_US_RXEN;
02581 }
02582 
02583 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02584 //* \fn    AT91F_US_EnableTx
02585 //* \brief Enable sending characters
02586 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02587 __inline void AT91F_US_EnableTx (
02588         AT91PS_USART pUSART)     // \arg pointer to a USART controller
02589 {
02590     //* Enable  transmitter
02591     pUSART->US_CR = AT91C_US_TXEN;
02592 }
02593 
02594 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02595 //* \fn    AT91F_US_ResetRx
02596 //* \brief Reset Receiver and re-enable it
02597 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02598 __inline void AT91F_US_ResetRx (
02599         AT91PS_USART pUSART)     // \arg pointer to a USART controller
02600 {
02601         //* Reset receiver
02602         pUSART->US_CR = AT91C_US_RSTRX;
02603     //* Re-Enable receiver
02604     pUSART->US_CR = AT91C_US_RXEN;
02605 }
02606 
02607 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02608 //* \fn    AT91F_US_ResetTx
02609 //* \brief Reset Transmitter and re-enable it
02610 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02611 __inline void AT91F_US_ResetTx (
02612         AT91PS_USART pUSART)     // \arg pointer to a USART controller
02613 {
02614         //* Reset transmitter
02615         pUSART->US_CR = AT91C_US_RSTTX;
02616     //* Enable transmitter
02617     pUSART->US_CR = AT91C_US_TXEN;
02618 }
02619 
02620 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02621 //* \fn    AT91F_US_DisableRx
02622 //* \brief Disable Receiver
02623 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02624 __inline void AT91F_US_DisableRx (
02625         AT91PS_USART pUSART)     // \arg pointer to a USART controller
02626 {
02627     //* Disable receiver
02628     pUSART->US_CR = AT91C_US_RXDIS;
02629 }
02630 
02631 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02632 //* \fn    AT91F_US_DisableTx
02633 //* \brief Disable Transmitter
02634 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02635 __inline void AT91F_US_DisableTx (
02636         AT91PS_USART pUSART)     // \arg pointer to a USART controller
02637 {
02638     //* Disable transmitter
02639     pUSART->US_CR = AT91C_US_TXDIS;
02640 }
02641 
02642 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02643 //* \fn    AT91F_US_Close
02644 //* \brief Close USART: disable IT disable receiver and transmitter, close PDC
02645 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02646 __inline void AT91F_US_Close (
02647         AT91PS_USART pUSART)     // \arg pointer to a USART controller
02648 {
02649     //* Reset the baud rate divisor register
02650     pUSART->US_BRGR = 0 ;
02651 
02652     //* Reset the USART mode
02653     pUSART->US_MR = 0  ;
02654 
02655     //* Reset the Timeguard Register
02656     pUSART->US_TTGR = 0;
02657 
02658     //* Disable all interrupts
02659     pUSART->US_IDR = 0xFFFFFFFF ;
02660 
02661     //* Abort the Peripheral Data Transfers
02662     AT91F_PDC_Close((AT91PS_PDC) &(pUSART->US_RPR));
02663 
02664     //* Disable receiver and transmitter and stop any activity immediately
02665     pUSART->US_CR = AT91C_US_TXDIS | AT91C_US_RXDIS | AT91C_US_RSTTX | AT91C_US_RSTRX ;
02666 }
02667 
02668 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02669 //* \fn    AT91F_US_TxReady
02670 //* \brief Return 1 if a character can be written in US_THR
02671 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02672 __inline unsigned int AT91F_US_TxReady (
02673         AT91PS_USART pUSART )     // \arg pointer to a USART controller
02674 {
02675     return (pUSART->US_CSR & AT91C_US_TXRDY);
02676 }
02677 
02678 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02679 //* \fn    AT91F_US_RxReady
02680 //* \brief Return 1 if a character can be read in US_RHR
02681 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02682 __inline unsigned int AT91F_US_RxReady (
02683         AT91PS_USART pUSART )     // \arg pointer to a USART controller
02684 {
02685     return (pUSART->US_CSR & AT91C_US_RXRDY);
02686 }
02687 
02688 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02689 //* \fn    AT91F_US_Error
02690 //* \brief Return the error flag
02691 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02692 __inline unsigned int AT91F_US_Error (
02693         AT91PS_USART pUSART )     // \arg pointer to a USART controller
02694 {
02695     return (pUSART->US_CSR &
02696         (AT91C_US_OVRE |  // Overrun error
02697          AT91C_US_FRAME | // Framing error
02698          AT91C_US_PARE));  // Parity error
02699 }
02700 
02701 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02702 //* \fn    AT91F_US_PutChar
02703 //* \brief Send a character,does not check if ready to send
02704 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02705 __inline void AT91F_US_PutChar (
02706         AT91PS_USART pUSART,
02707         int character )
02708 {
02709     pUSART->US_THR = (character & 0x1FF);
02710 }
02711 
02712 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02713 //* \fn    AT91F_US_GetChar
02714 //* \brief Receive a character,does not check if a character is available
02715 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02716 __inline int AT91F_US_GetChar (
02717         const AT91PS_USART pUSART)
02718 {
02719     return((pUSART->US_RHR) & 0x1FF);
02720 }
02721 
02722 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02723 //* \fn    AT91F_US_SendFrame
02724 //* \brief Return 2 if PDC has been initialized with Buffer and Next Buffer, 1 if PDC has been initializaed with Next Buffer, 0 if PDC is busy
02725 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02726 __inline unsigned int AT91F_US_SendFrame(
02727         AT91PS_USART pUSART,
02728         char *pBuffer,
02729         unsigned int szBuffer,
02730         char *pNextBuffer,
02731         unsigned int szNextBuffer )
02732 {
02733         return AT91F_PDC_SendFrame(
02734                 (AT91PS_PDC) &(pUSART->US_RPR),
02735                 pBuffer,
02736                 szBuffer,
02737                 pNextBuffer,
02738                 szNextBuffer);
02739 }
02740 
02741 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02742 //* \fn    AT91F_US_ReceiveFrame
02743 //* \brief Return 2 if PDC has been initialized with Buffer and Next Buffer, 1 if PDC has been initializaed with Next Buffer, 0 if PDC is busy
02744 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02745 __inline unsigned int AT91F_US_ReceiveFrame (
02746         AT91PS_USART pUSART,
02747         char *pBuffer,
02748         unsigned int szBuffer,
02749         char *pNextBuffer,
02750         unsigned int szNextBuffer )
02751 {
02752         return AT91F_PDC_ReceiveFrame(
02753                 (AT91PS_PDC) &(pUSART->US_RPR),
02754                 pBuffer,
02755                 szBuffer,
02756                 pNextBuffer,
02757                 szNextBuffer);
02758 }
02759 
02760 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02761 //* \fn    AT91F_US_SetIrdaFilter
02762 //* \brief Set the value of IrDa filter tregister
02763 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02764 __inline void AT91F_US_SetIrdaFilter (
02765         AT91PS_USART pUSART,
02766         unsigned char value
02767 )
02768 {
02769         pUSART->US_IF = value;
02770 }

02792         AT91PS_TWI pTWI, // \arg pointer to a TWI controller

02799 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02800 //* \fn    AT91F_TWI_Configure
02801 //* \brief Configure TWI in master mode
02802 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02803 __inline void AT91F_TWI_Configure ( AT91PS_TWI pTWI )          // \arg pointer to a TWI controller
02804 {
02805     //* Disable interrupts
02806         pTWI->TWI_IDR = (unsigned int) -1;
02807 
02808     //* Reset peripheral
02809         pTWI->TWI_CR = AT91C_TWI_SWRST;
02810 
02811         //* Set Master mode
02812         pTWI->TWI_CR = AT91C_TWI_MSEN;
02813 
02814 }
02815 
02816 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------

02821         AT91PS_TWI pTwi) // \arg  pointer to a TWI controller
02822 {
02823         return pTwi->TWI_IMR;
02824 }

02831         AT91PS_TWI pTwi,   // \arg  pointer to a TWI controller
02832         unsigned int flag) // \arg  flag to be tested
02833 {
02834         return (AT91F_TWI_GetInterruptMaskStatus(pTwi) & flag);
02835 }

02950 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02951 //* \fn    AT91F_PWM_CfgChannel
02952 //* \brief Test if PWM Interrupt is Set
02953 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
02954 __inline void AT91F_PWMC_CfgChannel(
02955         AT91PS_PWMC pPWM,   // \arg  pointer to a PWM controller
02956         unsigned int channelId, // \arg PWM channel ID
02957         unsigned int mode, // \arg  PWM mode
02958         unsigned int period, // \arg PWM period
02959         unsigned int duty) // \arg PWM duty cycle
02960 {
02961         pPWM->PWMC_CH[channelId].PWMC_CMR = mode;
02962         pPWM->PWMC_CH[channelId].PWMC_CDTYR = duty;
02963         pPWM->PWMC_CH[channelId].PWMC_CPRDR = period;
02964 }

02973 {
02974         pPWM->PWMC_ENA = flag;
02975 }

02980 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------

02982         AT91PS_PWMC pPWM,   // \arg  pointer to a PWM controller
02983         unsigned int flag) // \arg  Channels IDs to be enabled
02984 {
02985         pPWM->PWMC_DIS = flag;
02986 }

02993         AT91PS_PWMC pPWM,   // \arg  pointer to a PWM controller
02994         unsigned int channelId, // \arg PWM channel ID
02995         unsigned int update) // \arg  Channels IDs to be enabled
02996 {

03007 __inline void AT91F_UDP_EnableIt (
03008         AT91PS_UDP pUDP,     // \arg pointer to a UDP controller
03009         unsigned int flag)   // \arg IT to be enabled
03010 {
03011         //* Write to the IER register
03012         pUDP->UDP_IER = flag;
03013 }
03014 
03015 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03016 //* \fn    AT91F_UDP_DisableIt
03017 //* \brief Disable UDP IT
03018 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03019 __inline void AT91F_UDP_DisableIt (
03020         AT91PS_UDP pUDP,     // \arg pointer to a UDP controller
03021         unsigned int flag)   // \arg IT to be disabled
03022 {
03023         //* Write to the IDR register
03024         pUDP->UDP_IDR = flag;
03025 }
