03027 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03028 //* \fn    AT91F_UDP_SetAddress
03029 //* \brief Set UDP functional address
03030 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03031 __inline void AT91F_UDP_SetAddress (
03032         AT91PS_UDP pUDP,     // \arg pointer to a UDP controller
03033         unsigned char address)   // \arg new UDP address
03034 {
03035         pUDP->UDP_FADDR = (AT91C_UDP_FEN | address);
03036 }
03037 
03038 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03039 //* \fn    AT91F_UDP_EnableEp
03040 //* \brief Enable Endpoint
03041 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03042 __inline void AT91F_UDP_EnableEp (
03043         AT91PS_UDP pUDP,     // \arg pointer to a UDP controller
03044         unsigned char endpoint)   // \arg endpoint number
03045 {
03046         pUDP->UDP_CSR[endpoint] |= AT91C_UDP_EPEDS;
03047 }
03048 
03049 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03050 //* \fn    AT91F_UDP_DisableEp
03051 //* \brief Enable Endpoint
03052 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03053 __inline void AT91F_UDP_DisableEp (
03054         AT91PS_UDP pUDP,     // \arg pointer to a UDP controller
03055         unsigned char endpoint)   // \arg endpoint number
03056 {
03057         pUDP->UDP_CSR[endpoint] &= ~AT91C_UDP_EPEDS;
03058 }
03059 
03060 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03061 //* \fn    AT91F_UDP_SetState
03062 //* \brief Set UDP Device state
03063 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03064 __inline void AT91F_UDP_SetState (
03065         AT91PS_UDP pUDP,     // \arg pointer to a UDP controller
03066         unsigned int flag)   // \arg new UDP address
03067 {
03068         pUDP->UDP_GLBSTATE  &= ~(AT91C_UDP_FADDEN | AT91C_UDP_CONFG);
03069         pUDP->UDP_GLBSTATE  |= flag;
03070 }
03071 
03072 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03073 //* \fn    AT91F_UDP_GetState
03074 //* \brief return UDP Device state
03075 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03076 __inline unsigned int AT91F_UDP_GetState ( // \return the UDP device state
03077         AT91PS_UDP pUDP)     // \arg pointer to a UDP controller
03078 {
03079         return (pUDP->UDP_GLBSTATE  & (AT91C_UDP_FADDEN | AT91C_UDP_CONFG));
03080 }
03081 
03082 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03083 //* \fn    AT91F_UDP_ResetEp
03084 //* \brief Reset UDP endpoint
03085 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03086 __inline void AT91F_UDP_ResetEp ( // \return the UDP device state
03087         AT91PS_UDP pUDP,     // \arg pointer to a UDP controller
03088         unsigned int flag)   // \arg Endpoints to be reset
03089 {
03090         pUDP->UDP_RSTEP = flag;
03091         pUDP->UDP_RSTEP = 0;
03092 }
03093 
03094 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03095 //* \fn    AT91F_UDP_EpStall
03096 //* \brief Endpoint will STALL requests
03097 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03098 __inline void AT91F_UDP_EpStall(
03099         AT91PS_UDP pUDP,     // \arg pointer to a UDP controller
03100         unsigned char endpoint)   // \arg endpoint number
03101 {
03102         pUDP->UDP_CSR[endpoint] |= AT91C_UDP_FORCESTALL;
03103 }
03104 
03105 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03106 //* \fn    AT91F_UDP_EpWrite
03107 //* \brief Write value in the DPR
03108 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03109 __inline void AT91F_UDP_EpWrite(
03110         AT91PS_UDP pUDP,         // \arg pointer to a UDP controller
03111         unsigned char endpoint,  // \arg endpoint number
03112         unsigned char value)     // \arg value to be written in the DPR
03113 {
03114         pUDP->UDP_FDR[endpoint] = value;
03115 }
03116 
03117 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03118 //* \fn    AT91F_UDP_EpRead
03119 //* \brief Return value from the DPR
03120 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03121 __inline unsigned int AT91F_UDP_EpRead(
03122         AT91PS_UDP pUDP,         // \arg pointer to a UDP controller
03123         unsigned char endpoint)  // \arg endpoint number
03124 {
03125         return pUDP->UDP_FDR[endpoint];
03126 }
03127 
03128 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03129 //* \fn    AT91F_UDP_EpEndOfWr
03130 //* \brief Notify the UDP that values in DPR are ready to be sent
03131 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03132 __inline void AT91F_UDP_EpEndOfWr(
03133         AT91PS_UDP pUDP,         // \arg pointer to a UDP controller
03134         unsigned char endpoint)  // \arg endpoint number
03135 {
03136         pUDP->UDP_CSR[endpoint] |= AT91C_UDP_TXPKTRDY;
03137 }
03138 
03139 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03140 //* \fn    AT91F_UDP_EpClear
03141 //* \brief Clear flag in the endpoint CSR register
03142 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03143 __inline void AT91F_UDP_EpClear(
03144         AT91PS_UDP pUDP,         // \arg pointer to a UDP controller
03145         unsigned char endpoint,  // \arg endpoint number
03146         unsigned int flag)       // \arg flag to be cleared
03147 {
03148         pUDP->UDP_CSR[endpoint] &= ~(flag);
03149 }
03150 
03151 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03152 //* \fn    AT91F_UDP_EpSet
03153 //* \brief Set flag in the endpoint CSR register
03154 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03155 __inline void AT91F_UDP_EpSet(
03156         AT91PS_UDP pUDP,         // \arg pointer to a UDP controller
03157         unsigned char endpoint,  // \arg endpoint number
03158         unsigned int flag)       // \arg flag to be cleared
03159 {
03160         pUDP->UDP_CSR[endpoint] |= flag;
03161 }
03162 
03163 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03164 //* \fn    AT91F_UDP_EpStatus
03165 //* \brief Return the endpoint CSR register
03166 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03167 __inline unsigned int AT91F_UDP_EpStatus(
03168         AT91PS_UDP pUDP,         // \arg pointer to a UDP controller
03169         unsigned char endpoint)  // \arg endpoint number
03170 {
03171         return pUDP->UDP_CSR[endpoint];
03172 }
03173 
03174 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03175 //* \fn    AT91F_UDP_GetInterruptMaskStatus
03176 //* \brief Return UDP Interrupt Mask Status
03177 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03178 __inline unsigned int AT91F_UDP_GetInterruptMaskStatus(
03179   AT91PS_UDP pUdp)        // \arg  pointer to a UDP controller
03180 {
03181   return pUdp->UDP_IMR;
03182 }
03183 
03184 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03185 //* \fn    AT91F_UDP_IsInterruptMasked
03186 //* \brief Test if UDP Interrupt is Masked 
03187 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03188 __inline int AT91F_UDP_IsInterruptMasked(
03189   AT91PS_UDP pUdp,       // \arg  pointer to a UDP controller
03190   unsigned int flag)     // \arg  flag to be tested
03191 {
03192   return (AT91F_UDP_GetInterruptMaskStatus(pUdp) & flag);
03193 }
03194 
03195 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03196 //  \fn    AT91F_UDP_InterruptStatusRegister
03197 //  \brief Return the Interrupt Status Register
03198 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03199 __inline unsigned int AT91F_UDP_InterruptStatusRegister( 
03200   AT91PS_UDP pUDP )      // \arg  pointer to a UDP controller
03201 {
03202   return pUDP->UDP_ISR;
03203 }
03204 
03205 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03206 //  \fn    AT91F_UDP_InterruptClearRegister
03207 //  \brief Clear Interrupt Register
03208 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03209 __inline void AT91F_UDP_InterruptClearRegister (
03210   AT91PS_UDP pUDP,       // \arg pointer to UDP controller
03211   unsigned int flag)     // \arg IT to be cleat
03212 {
03213   pUDP->UDP_ICR = flag; 
03214 }
03215 
03216 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03217 //  \fn    AT91F_UDP_EnableTransceiver
03218 //  \brief Enable transceiver
03219 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03220 __inline void AT91F_UDP_EnableTransceiver( 
03221   AT91PS_UDP pUDP )      // \arg  pointer to a UDP controller
03222 {
03223     pUDP->UDP_TXVC &= ~AT91C_UDP_TXVDIS; 
03224 }
03225 
03226 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03227 //  \fn    AT91F_UDP_DisableTransceiver
03228 //  \brief Disable transceiver
03229 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03230 __inline void AT91F_UDP_DisableTransceiver( 
03231   AT91PS_UDP pUDP )      // \arg  pointer to a UDP controller
03232 {
03233     pUDP->UDP_TXVC = AT91C_UDP_TXVDIS; 
03234 }
03235

03239 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03240 __inline void AT91F_MC_CfgPMC (void)
03241 {
03242         AT91F_PMC_EnablePeriphClock(
03243                 AT91C_BASE_PMC, // PIO controller base address
03244                 ((unsigned int) 1 << AT91C_ID_SYS));
03245 }
03246

03260 //* \brief Configure PIO controllers to drive DBGU signals
03261 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03262 __inline void AT91F_DBGU_CfgPIO (void)
03263 {
03264         // Configure PIO controllers to periph mode
03265         AT91F_PIO_CfgPeriph(
03266                 AT91C_BASE_PIOA, // PIO controller base address
03267                 ((unsigned int) AT91C_PA10_DTXD    ) |
03268                 ((unsigned int) AT91C_PA9_DRXD    ), // Peripheral A
03269                 0); // Peripheral B
03270 }
03271

03658 __inline void AT91F_US0_CfgPMC (void)
03659 {
03660         AT91F_PMC_EnablePeriphClock(
03661                 AT91C_BASE_PMC, // PIO controller base address
03662                 ((unsigned int) 1 << AT91C_ID_US0));
03663 }
03664 
03665 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03666 //* \fn    AT91F_US0_CfgPIO
03667 //* \brief Configure PIO controllers to drive US0 signals
03668 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03669 __inline void AT91F_US0_CfgPIO (void)
03670 {
03671         // Configure PIO controllers to periph mode
03672         AT91F_PIO_CfgPeriph(
03673                 AT91C_BASE_PIOA, // PIO controller base address
03674                 ((unsigned int) AT91C_PA5_RXD0    ) |
03675                 ((unsigned int) AT91C_PA6_TXD0    ) |
03676                 ((unsigned int) AT91C_PA7_RTS0    ) |
03677                 ((unsigned int) AT91C_PA8_CTS0    ), // Peripheral A
03678                 ((unsigned int) AT91C_PA2_SCK0    )); // Peripheral B
03679 }
03680 
03681 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03682 //* \fn    AT91F_UDP_CfgPMC
03683 //* \brief Enable Peripheral clock in PMC for  UDP
03684 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03685 __inline void AT91F_UDP_CfgPMC (void)
03686 {
03687         AT91F_PMC_EnablePeriphClock(
03688                 AT91C_BASE_PMC, // PIO controller base address
03689                 ((unsigned int) 1 << AT91C_ID_UDP));
03690 }
03691 
03692 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03693 //* \fn    AT91F_AIC_CfgPMC
03694 //* \brief Enable Peripheral clock in PMC for  AIC
03695 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03696 __inline void AT91F_AIC_CfgPMC (void)
03697 {
03698         AT91F_PMC_EnablePeriphClock(
03699                 AT91C_BASE_PMC, // PIO controller base address
03700                 ((unsigned int) 1 << AT91C_ID_IRQ0) |
03701                 ((unsigned int) 1 << AT91C_ID_FIQ) |
03702                 ((unsigned int) 1 << AT91C_ID_IRQ1));
03703 }
03704 
03705 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03706 //* \fn    AT91F_AIC_CfgPIO
03707 //* \brief Configure PIO controllers to drive AIC signals
03708 //*----------------------------------------------------------------------------
03709 __inline void AT91F_AIC_CfgPIO (void)
03710 {
03711         // Configure PIO controllers to periph mode
03712         AT91F_PIO_CfgPeriph(
03713                 AT91C_BASE_PIOA, // PIO controller base address
03714                 ((unsigned int) AT91C_PA30_IRQ1    ), // Peripheral A
03715                 ((unsigned int) AT91C_PA20_IRQ0    ) |
03716                 ((unsigned int) AT91C_PA19_FIQ     )); // Peripheral B
03717 }
